meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect the joints of something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unjoints the puzzle pieces to put them back in the box.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic unjoints the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: He unjoints the Lego pieces, creating chaos in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The magician unjoints the rings, making them appear to float in mid-air.
meanings.sent5: The chef unjoints the chicken wings before marinating them.

meanings.definition: To disassemble or take apart the joints of something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter unjoints the old chair to refurbish it.
meanings.sent2: They unjoints the bike to clean and grease the parts.
meanings.sent3: He unjoints the robot toy, hoping to find the source of the malfunction.
meanings.sent4: The engineer unjoints the machine, revealing its intricate inner workings.
meanings.sent5: She unjoints the clock to repair the mechanism inside.

meanings.definition: Not joined or connected at the joints.
meanings.sent1: The unjoints pieces of wood do not form a stable structure.
meanings.sent2: The unjoints sections of the pipe cause leaks in the plumbing system.
meanings.sent3: The unjoints limbs of the scarecrow give it a quirky appearance.
meanings.sent4: The unjoints branches of the tree sway independently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unjoints panels of the door creak when opened.
